website_summaries.verdict: You'll like the power you'll receive with this gaming laptop, although it has a high price point.
pros: Great display screen with full HD resolution and a fast 120Hz refresh rate that's perfect for gaming and movies
Excellent laptop that includes a top-end quad core CPU
Includes a huge 2 TB hard drive and a 256 GB SSD for fast data retrieval
The impressive graphics card is VR ready and can handle high-end graphics
cons: Very high price point for a laptop

customer_reviews.title: Want to love it, but its not well designed
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this laptop being super thin and powerful, but it just isn't designed well: -for some games like destiny 2, the screen dims and un dims, and there isn't an intel driver fix for it. its just a power supply issue. one that cannot be fixed given the laptop wants to draw more power than the -laptop will just turn off underload: see power supply issue above. -keyboard feels bad, i know they are trying something new here, but it didn't work. Expected a lot more for the money here, I wouldn't buy it again or any other pro version of this from Razer at this point.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Gaming/College Laptop
customer_reviews.text: Excellent laptop that went beyond my expectations. Thought I'd list some Pros/Cons and Gaming stats I've found thus far: Pros: -Gets 5-6 hours of battery life doing simple tasks (web browsing, office, etc...) -Plenty of storage -120Hz refresh rate and Chroma support are nice additions Cons: -Fingerprint magnet (not a huge deal) -can get loud during gaming, but slim design makes up for it Gaming: -easily runs Overwatch on Ultra settings, 120 FPS -Resident Evil 7 on High settings ~ 90 FPS -PUBG max settings at 60 FPS -Have yet to hook up my VIve to it but will update once I try it
customer_reviews.author: Keegan Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Overheating issue
customer_reviews.text: The issue with the laptop is that in full graphic mode (non-whisper mode) it overheats and starts to cause errors with the graphics card. The intake vents are two small and exit vents are essentially blocked by the screen. I tried laptop cooling pads and elevating the laptop. Elevating seemed to help but after about an hour the laptop would crash. I owed the laptop for about two weeks and now Razer is replacing it. We will see if the new laptop will work properly. If not, I will continue to contact Razer to either honor the warranty or provide a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Brad
